messages.message: @Ted @dlluncor does anyone have any strong opinions on opencv 4.0? we accidentally upgraded image tasks from 3.4 to 4.0 and it's causing issues with non-backwards compatible API changes
Before David Bishops's py3 dockerfile prs (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/10698/files) i think it was set to 4.0 only in api-server-apps and emerson? was this an intentional switch?
@Ted replying in thread. Yea down to bump versions at some point, but i think it'll take a lot of updating and testing to make sure we don't break anything
For now, I'm going to bring everything back to the version specified in our devtools requirements.txt
Right a lot of those image libraries donâ€™t prioritize backwards compatibility :cry:

yupyup, and
in general when bumping versions, we have to read the changelogs for any API changes, especially when updating major versions
[11:11 AM]
lydia  it's always a bit of a bumpy process, but ideally if we also had updated it in our devtools requirements.txt, travis would have caught it in unit tests
@Ted do you know if emerson is intentionally using opencv 4?
It may have been to get access to EAST which ships with it
If Divya loaded east from elsewhere I think we can kick it
